alert.note: Alert for Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 8:33PM CDT until May 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Castro and Parmer. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.1 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor localized flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dimmitt, Friona, Hart, Bovina, Farwell, Summerfield, Lazbuddie, Easter, Black, Oklahoma Lane, Lariat, Rhea and Nazareth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
